title: PHPuasort()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPuasort()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example Sort the elements of an array by values using a user-defined comparison function (and maintains the index association): 4, "b"=>2, "c"=>8, "d"=>6); uasort($arr, "my_sort"); foreach($arr as $key => $value) { echo "[" . $key . "] => " . $value; echo "
"; } ?> Definition and Usage The uasort() function sorts an array by values using a user-defined comparison function and maintains the index association. Tip: Use the uksort() function to sort an array by keys using a user-defined comparison function. Tip: Use the usort() function to sort an array by values using a user-defined comparison function. Syntax uasort( array, callback ) Parameter Values Parameter Description array Required. Specifies the array to sort callback Required. A comparison function. Must return an integer <, =, or > than 0 if the first argument is <, =, or > than the second argument Technical Details Return Value: Always returns TRUE PHP Version: 4+ PHP Changelog: PHP 8.2.0: Now returns TRUE ( PHP 8.0.0: If callback expects a parameter to be passed by reference, it will now return an E_WARNING ★ +1

content_sections.title: Example
content_sections.code:
4, "b"=>2, "c"=>8, "d"=>6); uasort($arr, "my_sort"); foreach($arr as $key => $value) { echo "[" . $key . "] => " . $value; echo "
"; } ?>

summary: This tutorial covers PHPuasort()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPuasort()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPuasort()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
